channel.title: Interstate Highway History on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Interstate Highway History on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Cruis'n USA
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: If you’ve had a chance to ride on Interstate 180 in Cheyenne, Wyoming, you might have noticed something strange about the road. Despite being called an “interstate,” which implies a certain set of rules about what the road should look like, it doesn’t look anything like a freeway. In fact, it’s the only interstate highway in the continental United States that doesn’t meet federal standards for being an interstate highway.
